00020 /*
00021 Overview:
00022 
00023 btConeTwistConstraint can be used to simulate ragdoll joints (upper arm, leg etc).
00024 It is a fixed translation, 3 degree-of-freedom (DOF) rotational "joint".
00025 It divides the 3 rotational DOFs into swing (movement within a cone) and twist.
00026 Swing is divided into swing1 and swing2 which can have different limits, giving an elliptical shape.
00027 (Note: the cone's base isn't flat, so this ellipse is "embedded" on the surface of a sphere.)
00028 
00029 In the contraint's frame of reference:
00030 twist is along the x-axis,
00031 and swing 1 and 2 are along the z and y axes respectively.
00032 */
00033 
00034 
00035

00049 #endif //BT_USE_DOUBLE_PRECISION

00179         void    setLimit(int limitIndex,btScalar limitValue)
00180         {
00181                 switch (limitIndex)
00182                 {
00183                 case 3:
00184                         {
00185                                 m_twistSpan = limitValue;
00186                                 break;
00187                         }
00188                 case 4:
00189                         {
00190                                 m_swingSpan2 = limitValue;
00191                                 break;
00192                         }
00193                 case 5:
00194                         {
00195                                 m_swingSpan1 = limitValue;
00196                                 break;
00197                         }
00198                 default:
00199                         {
00200                         }
00201                 };
00202         }
00203 
00204     btScalar getLimit(int limitIndex) const
00205         {
00206                 switch (limitIndex)
00207                 {
00208                 case 3:
00209                         {
00210                                 return m_twistSpan;
00211                                 break;
00212                         }
00213                 case 4:
00214                         {
00215                                 return m_swingSpan2;
00216                                 break;
00217                         }
00218                 case 5:
00219                         {
00220                                 return m_swingSpan1;
00221                                 break;
00222                         }
00223                 default:
00224                         {
00225                             btAssert(0 && "Invalid limitIndex specified for btConeTwistConstraint");
00226                             return 0.0;
00227                         }
00228                 };
00229         }
00230 
00231         // setLimit(), a few notes:
00232         // _softness:
00233         //              0->1, recommend ~0.8->1.
00234         //              describes % of limits where movement is free.
00235         //              beyond this softness %, the limit is gradually enforced until the "hard" (1.0) limit is reached.
00236         // _biasFactor:
00237         //              0->1?, recommend 0.3 +/-0.3 or so.
00238         //              strength with which constraint resists zeroth order (angular, not angular velocity) limit violation.
00239         // __relaxationFactor:
00240         //              0->1, recommend to stay near 1.
00241         //              the lower the value, the less the constraint will fight velocities which violate the angular limits.
00242         void    setLimit(btScalar _swingSpan1,btScalar _swingSpan2,btScalar _twistSpan, btScalar _softness = 1.f, btScalar _biasFactor = 0.3f, btScalar _relaxationFactor = 1.0f)
00243         {
00244                 m_swingSpan1 = _swingSpan1;
00245                 m_swingSpan2 = _swingSpan2;
00246                 m_twistSpan  = _twistSpan;
00247 
00248                 m_limitSoftness =  _softness;
00249                 m_biasFactor = _biasFactor;
00250                 m_relaxationFactor = _relaxationFactor;
00251         }
00252

00317         // setMotorTarget:
00318         // q: the desired rotation of bodyA wrt bodyB.
00319         // note: if q violates the joint limits, the internal target is clamped to avoid conflicting impulses (very bad for stability)
00320         // note: don't forget to enableMotor()
00321         void setMotorTarget(const btQuaternion &q);
00322         const btQuaternion& getMotorTarget() const { return m_qTarget; }
00323 
00324         // same as above, but q is the desired rotation of frameA wrt frameB in constraint space
00325         void setMotorTargetInConstraintSpace(const btQuaternion &q);

00407 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE int   btConeTwistConstraint::calculateSerializeBufferSize() const
00408 {
00409         return sizeof(btConeTwistConstraintData2);

00413 
00415 SIMD_FORCE_INLINE const char*   btConeTwistConstraint::serialize(void* dataBuffer, btSerializer* serializer) const
00416 {
00417         btConeTwistConstraintData2* cone = (btConeTwistConstraintData2*) dataBuffer;
00418         btTypedConstraint::serialize(&cone->m_typeConstraintData,serializer);
00419 
00420         m_rbAFrame.serialize(cone->m_rbAFrame);
00421         m_rbBFrame.serialize(cone->m_rbBFrame);
00422         
00423         cone->m_swingSpan1 = m_swingSpan1;
00424         cone->m_swingSpan2 = m_swingSpan2;
00425         cone->m_twistSpan = m_twistSpan;
00426         cone->m_limitSoftness = m_limitSoftness;
00427         cone->m_biasFactor = m_biasFactor;
00428         cone->m_relaxationFactor = m_relaxationFactor;
00429         cone->m_damping = m_damping;
00430 
00431         return btConeTwistConstraintDataName;
00432 }
